title: About Me
text: Welcome! I’m excited to share a little bit more about myself.

title: About Me
text: Welcome! I’m excited to share a little bit more about myself.

title: About Me
text:
Where I’m From
I grew up in Morro Bay, where surfing and spending time in the ocean shaped my deep connection to nature. That early love for the coast and marine life inspired my passion for ocean protection and sustainability.

title: About Me
text:
What I’m Studying
I’m currently a third-year Environmental Studies major at UC Santa Barbara. My academic path reflects my interest in environmental protection, coastal ecosystems, and sustainable solutions for the future.

title: About Me
text:
What I Love
At UCSB, I’m a proud member of the surf team and continue to compete. Surfing is one of my biggest passions, it keeps me grounded and connected to the ocean I care so deeply about. When I’m not in the water, you’ll find me outside, hiking, doing yoga, or soaking up the sun.

title: About Me
text:
What I Do
I work as a lead coach for The Sea League (TSL) in Santa Barbara. TSL is an after-school program serving low-income youth, helping them build a relationship with the ocean through hands-on education. We explore the intertidal zone, teach about marine ecology, and encourage environmental stewardship.

title: RStudio Code For ENVS193
text:
The code below created a boxplot to compare the median particulate matter(PM 2.5) between Goleta and Santa Barbara with the interquartile range. This was done in order to better understand the impact of the Thomas Fire that occured in 2017-2018. Because the Thomas Fire burned from Ventura north, we wanted to further understand how it impacted Santa Barbara and Goleta which is slightly further north, but could have had differing impacts due to wind. The jittered points prevent overlapping so you can see the distribution clearly. 



Output

title: Sydney Beckett
text: Hey there, my name is Sydney! I am currently a 3rd year Environmental Studies student at University of California Santa Barbara. I am passionate about climate change and creating a sustainable future. Outside of school, I love to be outside, I am an avid surfer and I compete for my university.

title: Passions
text:
Ever since I could stand my dad has been pushing me into waves. Throughout my childhood I developed a passion that grew a bigger and bigger part of my life. When I was about 12 I started doing competitions through a program called NSSA with my best friend. I would travel up and down the coast practicing and getting better. In high school I also continued to compete for my high schools surf team, my dad was also the coach! And it didnt end when I graduated high school, I then got on the UCSB surf team and continue to surf and compete for the team now. I am so grateful to have this hobby that allows me to immerse myself in the ocean and feel so grounded in nature. Below are some images of me surfing from a very young age to present!



Surfing collage

title: Passions
text:
Traveling
I’ve been fortunate to spend much of my childhood—and continue to do so—traveling with family and friends. I love traveling because it allows me to explore new places, experience different cultures, and see the world from fresh perspectives. On my most recent adventure, I studied abroad in Australia. After school, seven friends and I traveled down the East Coast of Australia in a motorhome, from Brisbane to Sydney. We then flew to New Zealand, where we explored the North Island in another motorhome, chasing waves and embracing the spirit of adventure. Below is a little collage of some of the adventures during my time away!



Travel collage


Below I created a map of all of the places that I traveled after my study abroad! I used the leaflet package to create an interactive portion so you can click on each point to show what town/country it is in.
